stakeHolders.name: Vendor
stakeHolders.description: Vendors providing systems and tools that implement and support SNOMED CT.

kpas.name: Scope of SNOMED CT Implementation
kpas.description: Extent to which SNOMED CT is implemented across various clinical and administrative areas.

questions.name: Clinical Domains and Functional Areas
questions.question: How extensively is SNOMED CT implemented across clinical and administrative areas?

options.text: Used in only a few isolated areas.
Used in several modules but not consistently.
Integrated into most clinical areas with documented use.
Implemented across both clinical and administrative functions.
Fully integrated across all areas with continuous evaluation.

questions.name: Consistency of Use
questions.question: Is SNOMED CT consistently used across documentation, decision support, and interoperability?

options.text: Minimal use in isolated areas.
Some functional areas covered but with gaps.
Consistent use in multiple modules relevant to workflows.
Consistent use for documentation, decision support, and reporting.
Continuous improvement in usage across all domains.

kpas.name: Terminology Provisioning and Maintenance
kpas.description: Processes and systems in place to manage, update, and provision SNOMED CT terminology.

questions.name: Update Processes
questions.question: How structured and automated are the processes for updating SNOMED CT content?

options.text: Updates are manual and inconsistent.
Basic procedures exist but lack automation.
Standardized procedures and version control are in place.
Updates are tracked, partially automated, and consistently applied.
Fully automated updates with seamless integration.

questions.name: Localization and Notification
questions.question: How effectively are SNOMED CT updates localized and communicated to users?

options.text: No localization or update notifications.
Limited localization and inconsistent notifications.
Some localization with standardized notifications.
Users are notified consistently, and localization is systematic.
Seamless integration with real-time notifications.

kpas.name: Usability and Tool Support
kpas.description: Ease of use and functionality of tools supporting SNOMED CT for end-users.

questions.name: Search and Interface Usability
questions.question: How user-friendly are the search tools and interfaces for SNOMED CT?

options.text: Basic search tools that are cumbersome to use.
Search tools with filters or autocomplete but inconsistent usability.
Intuitive interfaces with consistent usability standards.
Advanced tools, such as NLP, enhance usability.
System adapts to user preferences with AI-driven features.

questions.name: Feedback and Usability Metrics
questions.question: How effectively is user feedback integrated to improve tool usability?

options.text: No usability feedback or metrics tracked.
Occasional feedback is used inconsistently.
Feedback is used to refine usability standards.
Usability metrics and feedback are actively tracked.
Real-time feedback drives continuous usability improvements.

kpas.name: Interoperability
kpas.description: Supporting seamless data exchange and collaboration using SNOMED CT.

questions.name: Data Exchange
questions.question: How effectively does your system support data exchange using SNOMED CT?

options.text: Minimal data exchange, no defined standards.
Some external integration but not standardized.
Supports integration with multiple systems using protocols.
Processes are tracked, and issues are proactively resolved.
Seamless, optimized data exchange with real-time feedback.

kpas.name: Advanced Decision Support and Analytics
kpas.description: Leveraging SNOMED CT for decision support and advanced analytics.

questions.name: Decision Support Integration
questions.question: How well are decision support tools integrated with SNOMED CT?

options.text: Minimal or no integration with decision support tools.
Limited tools with inconsistent integration.
Well-defined tools support clinical and operational decisions.
Effectively integrated tools with measurable outcomes.
Dynamic tools continuously improved for real-time insights.

questions.name: Analytics Capabilities
questions.question: What level of analytics capabilities are provided using SNOMED CT?

options.text: Basic or nonexistent analytics.
Limited insights generated from SNOMED CT data.
Analytics generate actionable insights supporting decisions.
Advanced analytics with metrics to evaluate impact.
Real-time analytics dynamically improve clinical decisions.

stakeHolders.name: User Organization
stakeHolders.description: Organizations that implement SNOMED CT within clinical settings.

stakeHolders.name: Member
stakeHolders.description: SNOMED International Members managing national SNOMED CT adoption.

kpas.name: Growth and Adoption
kpas.description: Increasing the adoption and use of SNOMED CT within national healthcare systems.

questions.name: Number of Affiliates vs Target
questions.question: How would you describe the current level of affiliate adoption of SNOMED CT in your region?

options.text: Few or no affiliates actively using SNOMED CT.
Initial efforts to promote SNOMED CT adoption, but uptake is inconsistent.
Adoption metrics such as affiliate numbers are being tracked.
Adoption strategies are implemented consistently across sectors.
SNOMED CT adoption is continuously monitored and improved.

questions.name: Monitoring and Metrics Strategy
questions.question: Is SNOMED CT adoption tracked and supported with metrics and monitoring strategies?

options.text: No tracking or monitoring across healthcare settings.
Minimal monitoring of SNOMED CT use in hospitals or clinical areas.
Metrics such as affiliate usage and hospitals are tracked.
Monitoring is supported by education, courses, and initiatives.
Monitoring and adoption strategies are dynamically improved.

kpas.name: Governance and Strategy
kpas.description: Establishing effective governance and strategic frameworks for SNOMED CT implementation and adoption.

questions.name: Governance Structure
questions.question: Is there a formal governance structure in place for managing SNOMED CT adoption?

options.text: No formal governance structure exists.
Basic governance structures exist but are inconsistently applied.
Governance frameworks are well-defined and active.
Comprehensive governance practices with regular reviews and stakeholder involvement.
Governance is continuously improved based on feedback.

questions.name: Strategic Alignment
questions.question: Are strategic goals and governance frameworks aligned with national healthcare priorities?

options.text: Implementation goals are unclear or undocumented.
Occasional alignment but no formal adoption strategy.
Goals are documented and aligned with priorities.
Goals are aligned with national health initiatives.
Goals are dynamically updated to meet emerging needs.

kpas.name: Stakeholder Engagement
kpas.description: Fostering collaboration and involvement of stakeholders in SNOMED CT adoption and implementation.

questions.name: Stakeholder Involvement
questions.question: How engaged are stakeholders in SNOMED CT adoption efforts?

options.text: Minimal or no engagement with stakeholders.
Occasional meetings with limited documentation.
Stakeholders actively involved in structured discussions.
Comprehensive engagement strategies in place.
Engagement strategies continuously refined.

questions.name: Resources for End-Users
questions.question: Are resources and support available for end-users?

options.text: No resources or support for end-users.
Basic resources exist but are limited in scope.
Structured resources such as FAQs and support channels.
Comprehensive resources with ongoing updates.
Resources continuously improved based on feedback.

kpas.name: National Extension Management
kpas.description: Managing national extensions, translations, and updates of SNOMED CT content.

questions.name: National Extension Processes
questions.question: Are processes in place for managing and updating national SNOMED CT content?

options.text: No national extension or processes for updating content.
Ad hoc efforts to develop extensions.
Regular updates and editorial guidelines exist.
Systematic and consistent processes applied.
Processes dynamically updated to meet evolving needs.

kpas.name: Complex Use Cases and Secondary Use
kpas.description: Supporting complex clinical scenarios and secondary data use through SNOMED CT.

questions.name: Use for Secondary Data
questions.question: How effectively is SNOMED CT being used for secondary data purposes?

options.text: No efforts to support secondary data use.
Initial attempts but with limited impact.
Used for basic analytics and reporting.
Embedded in workflows for advanced use cases.
Continuously refined for advanced analytics and research.
